channel.title: How do you make it so you can't attack your own team?
channel.description: In my latest project i have noticed that people on the "Blue" team can attack other "Blue" team members. how do i change it so they can only attack people on the "Red" Team (the other team)

item.title: How do you make it so you can't attack your own team?
item.dc:creator: @John459 John459
item.description:
@John459 wrote:

You might you something different than playerIndex2.

Read full topic

hween09 and playerIndex2 cannot be dereferenced.

item.title: How do you make it so you can't attack your own team?
item.dc:creator: @_icestorm ~*icestorm*~
item.description:
@_icestorm wrote:

This is the error i get when i try and add it to my Magic On Player area with playerindex2 and the second error is when i change it to playerindex

[code]client.java:16611: cannot find symbol
symbol : variable playerIndex2
location: class client
if (hween09 == 0 && playerIndex2.hween09 == 0 || hween09
== 5 && playerIndex2.hween09 == 5)
^

client.java:16611: cannot find symbol symbol : variable playerIndex2 location: class client if (hween09 == 0 && playerIndex2.hween09 == 0 || hween09 == 5 && playerIndex2.hween09 == 5) ^ 2 errors Finished! Press any key to continue . . .

[code]client.java:16611: int cannot be dereferenced
if (hween09 == 0 && playerIndex.hween09 == 0 || hween09
== 5 && playerIndex.hween09 == 5)
^
client.java:16611: int cannot be dereferenced
if (hween09 == 0 && playerIndex.hween09 == 0 || hween09
== 5 && playerIndex.hween09 == 5)

               ^

2 errors
Finished!
Press any key to continue . . .[/code]

Read full topic
item.source: How do you make it so you can't attack your own team?

item.title: How do you make it so you can't attack your own team?
item.dc:creator: @John459 John459
item.description:
@John459 wrote:

Go to your magic on players case (for me it’s case 239) and add this:

if (team1 == 1 && playerIndex2.team1 == 1 || team2 == 1 && playerIndex2.team2 == 1) { sM("You cannot attack players on your own team!"); break; }

Then go to your attacking in wilderness method (for me it’s case 73) and add this:

if (team1 == 1 && AttackingOn2.team1 == 1 || team2 == 1 && AttackingOn2.team2 == 1) { sM("You can't attack player's on your own team!"); break; }

Replace team1 and team2 without whatever integer you use for your teams.

Read full topic
item.source: How do you make it so you can't attack your own team?

item.title: How do you make it so you can't attack your own team?
item.dc:creator: @de_dust89 de dust89
item.description:
@de_dust89 wrote:

Well, we need to know all of your integers to help you. For example;

public boolean attackTeam() {

     if(isOnBlueTeam && playerTwoIsBlue) {
          playerOneAttacksplayerTwo = false;

     } else if(playerTwoIsRed) {
          playerOneAttacksplayerTwo = true;
     }
}

But fill in your integers.

EDIT: Also, I just quickly threw something up. This probably will not work.

Read full topic
